sanskrit_verse:
सोमविक्रयिणे विष्ठा भिषजे पूयशोणितम् ।
नष्टं देवलके दत्तमप्रतिष्ठं तु वार्धुषौ ॥ ३.१८०॥
transliteration:
somavikrayiṇe viṣṭhā bhiṣaje pūyaśoṇitam |
naṣṭaṃ devalake dattam apratiṣṭhaṃ tu vārdhuṣau || 3.180 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who sells Soma incurs excrement; the physician, pus and blood; what is given to a ruined temple is lost; and in the case of a courtesan, it has no stability.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority arises from alignment with cosmic order, not transactional exchange
Causation follows sequential manifestation rooted in consciousness distortion
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by role-specific dharmic integrity
Restoration logic requires reversal of value-depletion through conscious reintegration
Consciousness alignment depends on the purity of intention behind acts
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent sells sacred substance THEN consequence = degradation of personal sacred capacity
IF physician causes harm due to negligence THEN consequence = contamination of healing capacity
IF donation made to corrupted institution THEN consequence = loss of spiritual merit
IF wealth directed toward unstable vessel THEN consequence = absence of enduring result
supreme_court_application: In adjudication at the highest level, this verse establishes thresholds where material transactions involving sacred or life-supporting roles generate inherent karmic consequences that manifest as diminished capacity. Courts must recognize such outcomes not as punitive measures but as natural expressions of violated ontological alignment.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality confirms that when sacred substances like Soma are commodified, the actor's connection to divinity becomes obscured. The resulting condition reflects anupūrvaśaḥ — sequential unfolding of misaligned consciousness. Responsibility is proportional to the degree of deviation from svadharma. There is no external punishment; only self-induced diminishment requiring conscious correction.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate purification process for seller of Soma to restore access to sacred knowledge
Engage physician in service-based healing practice to regenerate true medical capacity
Realign donor’s intent through guided reconstruction of devotional infrastructure
Redirect courtesan’s energy into creative or educational channels to stabilize her societal contribution
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority of all Dharma. This law restores balance through awareness, not coercion. Reality responds to consciousness, never through punishment. All beings are capable of realignment.
